DOC.HEAD: Maryville-Alcoa Daily Times Sold
DOC.TEXT: The Maryville-Alcoa Daily Times was sold today to Persis Corp., owners of The Knoxville Journal. The purchase price was not disclosed. The Daily Times, with a circulation of 21,000, was established in 1883. It was sold by the Tutt S. Bradford family. Persis, based in Honolulu, bought the Knoxville paper in 1988. It also owns the Honolulu Advertiser plus two daily, three weekly and four free newspapers in the Seattle area.
